item.title: Overhanging/overgrown bushes and trees blocking bus stop, 9th July
item.description:
The trees/bushes at this property are so overgrown they are blocking the bus stop. This is resulting in some bus drivers not stopping as they don’t realise there’s a stop. Have reported to TFL, but they have come back and said it’s the local authority who are responsible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large rubbish on pathway sofas etc, 9th July
item.description:
Abandoned rubbish like sofas and dining chairs on pavement pulled from the council piece of land, has now been added to overnight by more rubbish and encouraging fly tipping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hylton Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unable to use most of pavement outside No 28, 9th July
item.description:
The front hedge of No 28 which is ‘Holly’ is so overgrown that there is only 12” pavement left , it is fully over the payment also has lamp post , it catches your clothes and prams & wheelchairs have to walk in the road . It had been getting worse and worse it is the complete length of the bungalow. There has been no attempting chop it back or even keepit trimmed .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Avenue, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect Street Signage Displayed (Motor Bike and Taxis Only), 9th July
item.description:
Incorrect Signage Displayed - This Road is permanently closed with a gate. Signage displayed shows motor bikes and taxis can use road, which is not correct and could be dangerous in the evening, as the gate is black.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keyworth Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree branches on road, 9th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellmeadow Road, Catford South, London

item.title: Unmarked surveillance camera attached to pole, 9th July
item.description:
Attached to the signpost at the junction of Byword Street and Trinity Square, and aimed westwards along the cycle lane, there is an unmarked surveillance camera. It's almost certainly illegal as it is unmarked, and there is no information as to who it belongs to and who to contact regarding GDPR requests. This should be removed ASAP. It may have captured whoever put it there when it was being installed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Hill, Whitechapel, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Pavement & Uplights around trees in Hazelmere Pedestrian Area, 9th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London

item.title: Oversized tree outside 24 muschamp blocking natural light, 9th July
item.description:
Disproportionately large tree Outside 24 Muschamp rd. Takes a lot of light from the houses and is overhanging into the gardens of 24 and 26 ( it has grown more than any other tree on the street). Please prune down to reasonable size. An email was sent about 2 months ago when southwark tree surgeons were in the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Muschamp Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
